quotes.quote: Remember always that the composer's pen is still mightier than the bow of the violinist; in you lie all the possibilities of the creation of beauty.
Composers shouldn't think too much - it interferes with their plagiarism.
It doesn't necessarily mean at all that the composer plays his own works best.
The composer opens the cage door for arithmetic, the draftsman gives geometry its freedom.
Competitions are for horses, not artists.
Composers love to write for symphony orchestras because the symphony is the Rolls Royce of musical instruments.
The composers could no longer direct all performances in person, and so the responsibility of interpreting their works in the spirit in which they had been conceived was placed upon conductors.
Composers are not all good conductors.
A composer is a guy who goes around forcing his will on unsuspecting air molecules, often with the assistance of unsuspecting musicians.
Any composer who is gloriously conscious that he is a composer must believe that he receives his inspiration from a source higher than himself.
If you're a composer, there's never a moment you're not working.
The further the music develops, the more complex the apparatus used by the composer to express his thoughts becomes.
A composer's job involves the decoration of fragments of time.
Every composer's music reflects in its subject-matter and in its style the source of the money the composer is living on while writing the music.
Many, many composers have only found their way to a certain form, through familiarizing themselves with texts.
A composer is not only an architect but also an inventor, and he should not build houses in which he cannot live.
The greatest composer does not sit down to work because he is inspired, but becomes inspired because he is working.
Composers should write tunes that chauffeurs and errand boys can whistle.
Composers are always going back to the past.
A good composer does not imitate; he steals.
Every composer knows the anguish and despair occasioned by forgetting ideas which one had no time to write down.
The old idea of a composer suddenly having a terrific idea and sitting up all night to write it is nonsense. Nighttime is for sleeping.
A composer knows that music is written by human beings for human beings and that music is a continuation of life, not something separated from it.
Composers often think in terms of music and not of an instrument itself.
God is the composer; you are the song.
Many composers today don't know what the human throat is.
A good composer is slowly discovered and a bad composer is slowly found out.
The real composer thinks about his work the whole time; he is not always conscious of this, but he is aware of it later when he suddenly knows what he will do.
If a composer could say what he had to say in words he would not bother trying to say it in music.
Composers are the only people who can hear good music above bad sounds.
If the composer withholds more than we anticipate, we experience a delicious falling sensation; we feel we have been torn from a stable point on the musical ladder and thrust into the void.
